statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -6 \\ -10 \\ -10 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ -4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -11 \\ 8 \\ 4 \\ -8 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -6 \\ -10 \\ -10 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -2 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 7 \\ -4 \\ -2 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -11 \\ 8 \\ 4 \\ -8 \end{array}\right].
